page.title: 06Education.
page.content: Stiperstones Primary School,the only school in our block, is a small school in Stiperstones.There are forty-two pupils and there are two classes, each with one teacher.Another teacher,Mrs Backwell, comes in one morning a week. There is also an ancillary helper who works ten hours a week.Meals are prepared by two cooks and supervised by two dinner ladies.There is one caretaker.The school also holds events out of school time such as discos, walks,bingo,beetle evenings and summer fairs.Children come from within a three mile radius.The school was built in 1872 and an extension built on in 1967. The school belongs to 'Group Four',a co-operative group with Hope, Worthen and Minsterley Primary Schools, having joint staff meetings and organising joint sport and curricular activities.
